content: Jan 23 Shares of U.S. auto part retailers fell sharply on Monday following a report that Amazon.com Inc  had set its sights on the $50 billion do-it-yourself after-market auto parts business.

content: U.S. auto parts retailer Advance Auto Parts Inc  reported a 4.8 percent fall in quarterly revenue as it grapples with "service shortfalls" and the unavailability of parts  sending the company's shares down more than 6 percent premarket.
